values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries

Meaningful swings appear a few times per season; we budget extra time and gear to handle sudden cold snaps or storm systems. Seasonal Weather at 7/10 and Natural Disasters at 8/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for seasonal extremes & variability.

Deep winter gloom lasts several weeks, so we plan strict routines, supplements, and possible getaways to maintain morale. Seasonal Weather at 7/10 and Environment at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for seasonal sunlight hours.

Roughly half the year is wonderful, half demands planning around heat, cold, or rain to enjoy time outside. Seasonal Weather at 7/10 and Environment at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for pleasant weather windows.

Basic needs are met but savings and extracurriculars are hard to sustain without extra support or side work. Minimum Wage at 7/10, Housing Situation at 5/10, and Childcare Support (Citizens) at 7/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for quality of life – lower-income tier.

Housing and childcare strain the budget, limiting savings and discretionary spending most months. Typical Software Salaries at 6/10, Housing Situation at 5/10, and Work-Life Balance at 7/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for quality of life – middle-income tier.
